page.title: 17THE BRICKWORKS-DEVELOPMENT.
page.content: Following the{1ST WORLD WAR, RUDGWICK brickworks continued to produce hand- made bricks numbering some{15 000}per week. This situation continued until after the{2ND WORLD WAR}when a{3_MOULD {BERRY BRICK MACHINE}was installed.This allowed the{OUTPUT}to be increased to some{45000}bricks a week but firing of the bricks continued to use the{COKE- {FIRED KILNS.}In{1964}further improve- ments were made, however,when the com- pany{PURCHASED}a modern{DUTCH ABSERSON {AUTOMATIC BRICK-MACHINE.}This made the the works capable of manufacturing up- wards of{250000}bricks a week.The fir- ing of bricks also underwent changes from the{TRADITIONAL}coke fired kilns to firing with{BUTANE GAS.}The system is timetabled to undergo{MODERNISATION again in{1986,}however, when{MAINS GAS is{PIPED}in. At present the brickyard has a staff of{51 MANUAL EMPLOYEES.
